intro: Carnarvonia araliifolia var. montana, commonly known as the mountain sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with high altitude and cool climates. It is often found in open woodlands and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
